components.data: Colect blood into heparinized blood collection tubes (for instance Li-heparinized tubes, Vacuette, Mundelein, IL, USA)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Colect blood into heparinized blood collection tubes (for instance Li-heparinized tubes, Vacuette, Mundelein, IL, USA)

components.data: Blood Collection
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Blood Collection

components.data: Blood can be stored at room temperature (22 ± 1ºC) up to 2 h prior lymphocyte separation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Blood can be stored at room temperature (22 ± 1ºC) up to 2 h prior lymphocyte separation.

components.data: Blood Collection
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Blood Collection

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Warm Histopaque-1077 density gradient medium (cat. No. 10771, Merck, Kenilworth, NJ, USA) at 37°C water bath (NE2-8D Unstirred digital water bath, Nickel-Electro Ltd., Weston-super-Mare, UK) for 30 min before use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Warm Histopaque-1077 density gradient medium (cat. No. 10771, Merck, Kenilworth, NJ, USA) at 37°C water bath (NE2-8D Unstirred digital water bath, Nickel-Electro Ltd., Weston-super-Mare, UK) for 30 min before use.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: In the laminar flow box, pour Histopaque-1077 medium (37°C) into a 15 conical tubes (TPP Techno Plastic Products AG, Trasadingen, Switzerland). For volumes, see 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In the laminar flow box, pour Histopaque-1077 medium (37°C) into a 15 conical tubes (TPP Techno Plastic Products AG, Trasadingen, Switzerland). For volumes, see 3).

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Overlay blood by gently pipetting onto Histopaque-1077 medium using ratio of approximately 1:1. IMPORTANT: To obtain good separation, both blood and Histopaque layers must be clearly separated before centrifugation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Overlay blood by gently pipetting onto Histopaque-1077 medium using ratio of approximately 1:1. IMPORTANT: To obtain good separation, both blood and Histopaque layers must be clearly separated before centrifugation.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Spin at 400 g (BR4i multifunction centrifuge, Thermo Electron Corp., Waltham, MA, USA) for 30 min at 37 °C after carefully balancing the tubes. IMPORTANT: brakes off!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at 400 g (BR4i multifunction centrifuge, Thermo Electron Corp., Waltham, MA, USA) for 30 min at 37 °C after carefully balancing the tubes. IMPORTANT: brakes off!

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: While removing the tubes from the centrifuge do not disturb the layering.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While removing the tubes from the centrifuge do not disturb the layering.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Collect the PBMC with sterile pasteur pipette at the interface of Histopaque-1077 medium and plasma into new 15 mL conical tubes. IMPORTANT: Try to avoid apsiring Histopaque-1077 medium as much as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect the PBMC with sterile pasteur pipette at the interface of Histopaque-1077 medium and plasma into new 15 mL conical tubes. IMPORTANT: Try to avoid apsiring Histopaque-1077 medium as much as possible.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Wash the PBMC by adding RPMI-1640 culture medium (cat. No. R8758, Merck) to make up 10 mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the PBMC by adding RPMI-1640 culture medium (cat. No. R8758, Merck) to make up 10 mL.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Spin at 280 g for 5 min at 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at 280 g for 5 min at 37 °C.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Discard the supernatant, resuspend the pellet and wash again by adding RPMI-1640 to make up 10 mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant, resuspend the pellet and wash again by adding RPMI-1640 to make up 10 mL.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Spin at 280 g for 5 min at 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at 280 g for 5 min at 37 °C.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Discard the supernatant, resuspend the pellet and add 1 ml RPMI 1640 culture medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant, resuspend the pellet and add 1 ml RPMI 1640 culture medium.

components.data: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Peripheral blood mononuclear cell (PBMC) separation

components.data: Cultivation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.data: Measure the cell concentration and viability using Counting chamber with spring clips (BRAND GMBH + CO KG, Wertheim, Germany). For that, mix 10 µL of the PBMC with trypan blue solution at 1:1 ratio and wait for at least 30 seconds before counting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Measure the cell concentration and viability using Counting chamber with spring clips (BRAND GMBH + CO KG, Wertheim, Germany). For that, mix 10 µL of the PBMC with trypan blue solution at 1:1 ratio and wait for at least 30 seconds before counting.

components.data: Cultivation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.data: Resuspend the cells in RPMI-1640 culture medium supplemented with with 20% fetal bovine serum (PAA Laboratories GmbH, Austria), 2 mmol/l glutamine, 100 UI/ml penicillin and 0.1 mg/ml streptomycin (all from Merck) at 1.0 × 10<sup>6 </sup>cells/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cells in RPMI-1640 culture medium supplemented with with 20% fetal bovine serum (PAA Laboratories GmbH, Austria), 2 mmol/l glutamine, 100 UI/ml penicillin and 0.1 mg/ml streptomycin (all from Merck) at 1.0 × 10<sup>6 </sup>cells/ml.

components.data: Cultivation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.data: PBMC are then stimulated by Phytohemaglutinin (cat. No. L1668, Merck) at a concentration of 10 µg/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: PBMC are then stimulated by Phytohemaglutinin (cat. No. L1668, Merck) at a concentration of 10 µg/ml.

components.data: Cultivation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.data: After stimulation, incubate at 37°C, 5% CO<sub>2</sub> in a humidified atmosphere (Galaxy 170R, Eppendorf AG, Hamburk, Germany) with loose lids.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After stimulation, incubate at 37°C, 5% CO<sub>2</sub> in a humidified atmosphere (Galaxy 170R, Eppendorf AG, Hamburk, Germany) with loose lids.

components.data: Cultivation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.data: Add cytochalasin B (cat. No. C6762, Merck) 44 h after PHA stimulation at a concentration of 6 ug/ml to block cells at cytokinesis. PBMC are then incubated at 37°C, 5% CO<sub>2</sub> in a humidified atmosphere with loose lids for next 28 h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add cytochalasin B (cat. No. C6762, Merck) 44 h after PHA stimulation at a concentration of 6 ug/ml to block cells at cytokinesis. PBMC are then incubated at 37°C, 5% CO<sub>2</sub> in a humidified atmosphere with loose lids for next 28 h.

source_data.section: Cultivation of PBMC

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: After the incubation, spin the cells at 280 g for 10 min at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the incubation, spin the cells at 280 g for 10 min at 37°C.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Wash the cells once with 5 mL of ice-cold fixative solution containing methanol:acetic acid (3:1) with 1% formaldehyde (all from Merck). IMPORTANT: The fixative should be added by slow dripping while vortexing the cells to prevent forming of clumps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the cells once with 5 mL of ice-cold fixative solution containing methanol:acetic acid (3:1) with 1% formaldehyde (all from Merck). IMPORTANT: The fixative should be added by slow dripping while vortexing the cells to prevent forming of clumps.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Spin at 200 g for 10 min at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at 200 g for 10 min at 4°C.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 5 mL of ice-cold fixative, this time without formaldehyde.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 5 mL of ice-cold fixative, this time without formaldehyde.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Spin again.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin again.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 5 mL of ice-cold fixative (without formaldehyde).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 5 mL of ice-cold fixative (without formaldehyde).

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Spin again.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Discard all but 0.5 mL of the supernatant and resuspend the cells in the remaining fluid. NOTE: Fixed cells can be stored at this point at -20°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard all but 0.5 mL of the supernatant and resuspend the cells in the remaining fluid. NOTE: Fixed cells can be stored at this point at -20°C.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Drip the resuspended cells (80 µL) using a pipette onto a clean, grease free slide that has been previously stored in a freezer from a height of at least 10 cm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drip the resuspended cells (80 µL) using a pipette onto a clean, grease free slide that has been previously stored in a freezer from a height of at least 10 cm.

components.data: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Harvest, fixation and slide preparation of PBMC

components.data: Allow the slides to dry at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the slides to dry at room temperature.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Staining

components.data: Stain air-dried slides using 4% Giemsa stain (cat. No. 32884, Merck) for 8 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stain air-dried slides using 4% Giemsa stain (cat. No. 32884, Merck) for 8 min.

source_data.section: Staining

components.data: Rinse in tap water and allow to dry at room temperature.

components.data: Evaluate stained samples using microscope (BX-51, Olympus, Tokyo, Japan) at 400fold original magnification.

source_data.description: Evaluate stained samples using microscope (BX-51, Olympus, Tokyo, Japan) at 400fold original magnification.

components.data: Sample evaluation
components.name: Section

components.data: Evaluate a total of 1000 binucleated (BN) cells for the frequency of micronuclei (MN).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Evaluate a total of 1000 binucleated (BN) cells for the frequency of micronuclei (MN).

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The cells should be BN.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The cells should be BN.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The two nuclei in a BN cell should have intact nuclear membranes and be situated within the same cytoplasmic boundary.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The two nuclei in a BN cell should have intact nuclear membranes and be situated within the same cytoplasmic boundary.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The two nuclei in a BN cell should be approximately equal in size, staining pattern and staining intensity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The two nuclei in a BN cell should be approximately equal in size, staining pattern and staining intensity.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The two nuclei within a BN cell may be attached by a fine nucleoplasmic bridge wich is no wider than one-fourth of the largest nuclear diameter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The two nuclei within a BN cell may be attached by a fine nucleoplasmic bridge wich is no wider than one-fourth of the largest nuclear diameter.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The two main nuclei in a BN cell may touch but ideally should not overlap each other. A cell with two overlapping nuclei can be scored only if the nuclear boundaries of each nucleus are distinguishable.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The two main nuclei in a BN cell may touch but ideally should not overlap each other. A cell with two overlapping nuclei can be scored only if the nuclear boundaries of each nucleus are distinguishable.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The cytoplasmic boundary or membrane of a binucleated cell should be intact and clearly distinguishable from the cytoplasmic boundary of adjacent cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The cytoplasmic boundary or membrane of a binucleated cell should be intact and clearly distinguishable from the cytoplasmic boundary of adjacent cells.

components.data: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for selecting binucleated cells (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: MN are morphologically identical to but smaller than nuclei with the following characteristics:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: MN are morphologically identical to but smaller than nuclei with the following characteristics:

components.data: The diameter of MN usually varies between 1/16th and 1/3rd of the mean diameter of the main nuclei, which corresponds to 1/256th and 1/9th of the area of one of the main nuclei in a BN cell, respectively.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The diameter of MN usually varies between 1/16th and 1/3rd of the mean diameter of the main nuclei, which corresponds to 1/256th and 1/9th of the area of one of the main nuclei in a BN cell, respectively.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: MN are usually round or oval in shape, non-refractile and therefore, be readily distinguishable from artefact.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: MN are usually round or oval in shape, non-refractile and therefore, be readily distinguishable from artefact.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: MN are not linked or connected to the main nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: MN are not linked or connected to the main nuclei.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: MN may touch but not overlap the main nuclei and the micronuclear boundary should be distinguishable from the nuclear boundary.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: MN may touch but not overlap the main nuclei and the micronuclear boundary should be distinguishable from the nuclear boundary.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: MN usually have the same staining intensity as the main nuclei but occasionally staining may be less or more intense.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: MN usually have the same staining intensity as the main nuclei but occasionally staining may be less or more intense.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)

components.data: The diameter of MN in human lymphocytes usually varies between 1/16 and 1/3 of the mean.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The diameter of MN in human lymphocytes usually varies between 1/16 and 1/3 of the mean.

components.data: Criteria for scoring MN (Fenech et al. 2000)
